critique: This document pertains to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act and delegates authority to the Civil Service Commission and the Secretary of Labor to issue regulations related to employment rights and reemployment rights for individuals leaving federal employment to work for Indian tribal organizations. It does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, or national security. It seems to promote a degree of tribal self-determination, which could be seen as favoring state/tribal control in certain aspects. It also seems to be a delegation of power, which could be seen as a restriction of executive power. It also seems to promote social inclusion by supporting tribal organizations.
